thread.title: South Austin taco icon to close — but owner hopes name will live on
thread.title_full: South Austin taco icon to close — but owner hopes name will live on

author: Will Anderson
title: South Austin taco icon to close — but owner hopes name will live on
text: Maria's Taco Xpress plans to close, possibly on April 1, because the property on South… more Arnold Wells/Staff Maria's Taco Xpress, a fixture of South Austin's eating, drinking and live music scenes, plans to shutter, felled by high property taxes and a business slowdown — although it could reopen in a new location. Owner Maria Corbalan is under contract to sell the property at 2529 S. Lamar Blvd. "in the coming months," according to the Austin American-Statesman . Maria's Taco Xpress plans to close, possibly on April 1, because the property on South… more Arnold Wells/Staff According to the Statesman, those taxes reached $50,000 last year on land valued by the Travis Central Appraisal District at more than $2.2 million — up 189 percent from its $760,000 tax valuation in 2012. Corbalan told the Statesman she's losing money daily and hasn't received a salary since April 2016. She hopes employees restart the business in a different locale. Taco Xpress began selling migas, breakfast tacos, chicken fajitas and more popular Tex-Mex dishes in 1996. The original building closed in 2005 and was replaced by a Walgreens, but the national pharmacy store chain built her a new location nearby . Taco Xpress reopened in 2006, the same year Corbalan bought the property for $250,000, according to the Statesman — so she could see a significant return on her investment. Check out this Austin Business Journal story from 2007 on Corbalan's other entrepreneurial pursuits over the years and her unconventional journey to the Texas capital. The Statesman reports the closure could come April 1, after a closing party. Will Anderson coordinates digital coverage of business news. Related Content
